title: BookFinder
excerpt: A simple app that lets you search for books and explore details about them. I built it to practice working with APIs and handling user input — and it turned out to be a really fun way to discover new reads along the way.

title: Memory Game
excerpt: A classic matching game where you flip cards and try to find pairs. I made it to sharpen my React state management skills and add a little playful challenge to my coding practice.

title: Menu React
excerpt: A digital restaurant menu built with React. It started as an experiment in rendering dynamic content and filtering data, but it taught me a lot about structuring reusable components.

title: To-Do List React
excerpt: A clean, simple to-do app focused on functionality and usability. It was one of my first full React projects — a great way to understand hooks, state updates, and making an interface that actually helps keep track of things.

title: Weather App
excerpt: A weather dashboard that fetches live data from an API. It’s simple, but I enjoyed figuring out how to display real-time info in a clean, minimal interface — plus, it’s always nice to know if I need a jacket.

title: Workout App
excerpt: An app to log and track workouts. This one pushed me to think about data structure, user interaction, and creating something practical that could actually be useful day to day.
